name: Pink Passion Alocasia
description: Alocasia brancifolia is a small, terrestrial plant native to the Philippines, particularly the island of Palawan. It belongs to the Araceae family and features upright stems (20-40 cm tall) with small, arrow-shaped to heart-shaped, dark green leaves with distinctive venation. The 'Pink Passion' form may have pink-tinged leaves or petioles. The plant displays an upright, bushy growth habit. Many species have distinctive leaf textures - some are velvety, others have metallic or iridescent surfaces that change color with viewing angle. In its native habitat, it grows in moist, shaded areas of tropical forests. In terrariums or indoor settings, this plant adds natural beauty with its distinctive foliage. It's popular among Alocasia enthusiasts for its compact size and attractive leaves.
careTips: Keep soil consistently moist but well-draining
Toxic if ingested - keep away from pets and children
Requires high humidity and consistent moisture
Dormant period in winter - reduce watering
